item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 19th January
item.description:
Hello I was wondering if someone could come and witness the crossroad signals at Cirencester road and moorend road on a Saturday morning. The lights for the Cirencester road travel are massively reducing the amount of time the lights are green compared to the weekday and it causes massive backlog back to spirax Sarco. And back the other way past Sainsbury's. They are on for around 20 seconds, whereas the moorend way is over double. On Saturdays the moorend traffic is minimal too in comparison with Cirencester road traffic.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Edge of road eroding opposite new housing development, 19th January
item.description:
The developer had temporarily placed traffic lights but this made vehicles use the opposite verge and this has meant the road edge is damaged and eroding away as traffic uses it more. The developer who placed traffic lights too wide on the other carriageway is at fault. This has been there since the temporary traffic lights were placed by the developer.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 19th January
item.description:
Customer has damaged their tyre on the pothole this happened on thurday afternoon (15/01/2025) and would like to claim via claim form.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage on Cyclepath, 19th January
item.description:
There is constant drainage problems on the cyclepath. I have reported several times - the drains need to be cleared regularly as it leads to standing water. Last week the 'floating bus stop' was indeed that - surrounded by water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
